Title: Sixty years of the great Chinese Communist Party 1921-1981
Notes: Last of a series marking the 60th anniversary of the CCP. The text reads "Adhere to the socialist road, adhere to the people's democratic dictatorship, which is the dictatorship of the proletariat, adhere to the leadership of the party, adhere to Marxism-Leninism-Mao Zedong Thought! Unite the people of all ethnic groups in the country, work with one heart and one mind, develop the socialist economy, and build a modern, highly democratic, highly civilized socialist nation!" The first part is an affirmation of the "Four Basic Principles", or "Four Cardinal Principles" (si xiang jiben yuanze, 四项基本原则), introduced by Deng Xiaoping in March 1979 to appease conservative Party leaders.
Theme: The Founding of the Chinese Communist Party (1921)Deng XiaopingFour Basic Principles (1979)
